medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower abdominal pain attributed to ovarian cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain first developed in 2008 and was investigated for a genitourinary origin before being found to be due to a 13.5 cm complex right adnexal mass. Following surgery, she underwent chemotherapy and reached complete clinical remission after 6 cycles.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, type 2 diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, past ovarian cancer treatment including optimal cytoreductive surgery, left hip and elbow repairs, drainage of a throat abscess, and recently had a melanoma removed via Mohs surgery.
medical_history.social_history: Semiretired college teacher, does not smoke, drinks socially, divorced with 2 adopted children who are now adults.
